segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 10. Kakudhavagga
segments.en: 10. With Kakudha

segments.pli: 99. Sīhasutta
segments.en: 99. The Lion

segments.pli: “Sīho, bhikkhave, migarājā sāyanhasamayaṃ āsayā nikkhamati;
segments.en: “Mendicants, towards evening the lion, king of beasts, emerges from his den,

segments.pli: āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambhati;
segments.en: yawns,

segments.pli: vijambhitvā samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketi;
segments.en: looks all around the four directions,

segments.pli: samantā catuddisaṃ anuviloketvā tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ nadati;
segments.en: and roars his lion’s roar three times.

segments.pli: tikkhattuṃ sīhanādaṃ naditvā gocarāya pakkamati.
segments.en: Then he sets out on the hunt.

segments.pli: So hatthissa cepi pahāraṃ deti, sakkaccaññeva pahāraṃ deti, no asakkaccaṃ;
segments.en: If he strikes an elephant, he does it carefully, not carelessly.

segments.pli: mahiṃsassa cepi pahāraṃ deti, sakkaccaññeva pahāraṃ deti, no asakkaccaṃ;
segments.en: If he strikes a buffalo …

segments.pli: gavassa cepi pahāraṃ deti, sakkaccaññeva pahāraṃ deti, no asakkaccaṃ;
segments.en: a cow …

segments.pli: dīpissa cepi pahāraṃ deti, sakkaccaññeva pahāraṃ deti, no asakkaccaṃ;
segments.en: a leopard …

segments.pli: khuddakānañcepi pāṇānaṃ pahāraṃ deti antamaso sasabiḷārānampi, sakkaccaññeva pahāraṃ deti, no asakkaccaṃ.
segments.en: or any smaller creatures—even a hare or a cat—he does it carefully, not carelessly.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: ‘Mā me yoggapatho nassā’ti.
segments.en: Thinking: ‘May I not lose my way.’

segments.pli: Sīhoti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgatassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
segments.en: ‘Lion’ is a term for the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.

segments.pli: Yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, tathāgato parisāya dhammaṃ deseti, idamassa hoti sīhanādasmiṃ.
segments.en: When the Realized One teaches Dhamma to an assembly, this is his lion’s roar.

segments.pli: Bhikkhūnañcepi, bhikkhave, tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, sakkaccaññeva tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, no asakkaccaṃ;
segments.en: When the Realized One teaches the monks …

segments.pli: bhikkhunīnañcepi, bhikkhave, tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, sakkaccaññeva tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, no asakkaccaṃ;
segments.en: nuns …

segments.pli: upāsakānañcepi, bhikkhave, tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, sakkaccaññeva tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, no asakkaccaṃ;
segments.en: laymen …

segments.pli: upāsikānañcepi, bhikkhave, tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, sakkaccaññeva tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, no asakkaccaṃ;
segments.en: laywomen …

segments.pli: puthujjanānañcepi, bhikkhave, tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti antamaso annabhāranesādānampi, sakkaccaññeva tathāgato dhammaṃ deseti, no asakkaccaṃ.
segments.en: or ordinary people—even food-carriers and hunters—he teaches them carefully, not carelessly.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Dhammagaru, bhikkhave, tathāgato dhammagāravo”ti.
segments.en: Because the Realized One has respect and reverence for the teaching.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.
